args: Please note that this story contains spoilers\nfor event ＂The Phantom's Ransom.＂
This be the last thing we ever ask of ye!\nWe're beggin' ye, Cap'n—just one show!
Well, this certainly seems like a big to-do.\nWhat's going on, Karina?
Oh, nothing much. I guess you remember\nhow I took on a substitute role in the opera\na while back, yes?
You mean when the lead singer of the\nSperanza Opera Troupe was kidnapped?
You played a princess torn by a tragic\nromance—and you were great!

Yar, so we heard! But we sea rats were
out on the bilgey blue when our fair cap'n
performed, and we wanna be seein' her,
so we do.
Ye gotta let us see ya, Cap'n! Ya just gotta!\nWhy, even me parrot's gonna cry salty\ntears if ya don't give us a show.
Ugh, fine. If it'll stop all this belly-aching,\nI'll do it. I still have the dress, after all.
ALL HAIL THE CAP'N! HIP HIP, YAR!
Though I fear I'll be something of a\none-woman show without the orchestra.
But that's no excuse for not putting on the\nbest performance I can—so get ready to\nbawl your beady little eyes out, boys!
Word of Karina's upcoming performance spreads\nin an instant throughout the Halidom.
La la laaaaaa! Ah, that's excellent.\nSounds like the pipes are still pipin'.\nTime to get this show on the...
...road? Okay, what's with all the people?!
They're excited to see you, Karina!\nIt's not every day they get to experience\nan actual opera, after all.
Gar, but ye look a sight! Why, the sun\nshimmerin' over the horizon could scarce\nshine brighter'n ye are now!
Ye look a princess fair and true, Cap'n!
Shut your traps, you sealubbers!\nYou're supposed to be QUIET\nwhen you're in a theater!
Close enough. Now then! If no one has\nanything else they feel like yelling,\nlet the show begin!
Hold my hand and I will feel no fear. ♪
Amid our restless feelings,\nthe future draws near. ♪
Well? How'd you scurvy dogs like it?
Brilliant, Cap'n! Absolutely brilliant!\nI'd sell me dear old ma's peg leg\nto hear just a minute more!
I've never been so moved in all me days!\nI shed a tear, so I did! A real one, by gar!
I ain't never seen an opera, Cap'n,\nbut ye made this old salt's heart sing.
You haven't... Wait, is this the first time\nANY of you have seen an opera?
I be born in the boonies, and there warn't\na proper theater around for forty leagues.
I grew up near a big town with a theater,\nbut me family be so poor, we couldn't\nafford to go.
Yar, and I be so overpowered by the\nfanciness of the theater that I couldn't\neven make me legs approach it...
Figured all them rich folk would think\ncommonfolk like me weren't welcome\nat their fancy hornpipe party...
So THIS is what the prince meant!
(Now that I think back on it, the only\npeople I ever saw at the opera were\nother nobles and upper-crust types.)
(In other words, only a handful of people\nare ever able to see the truly wonderful art\nthat is the opera.)
(The idea our world is so unequal that\nsome don't have the freedom to do such\nthings is an injustice I cannot stand!)
That does it! From this day forth, I'm going\nto set out on my ship and deliver opera\nto the entire world!
Yar, what do ye mean, Cap'n?!

I mean, I'm gonna sail my ship across
the ocean blue to shores without
professional companies and bring
free opera to the masses!
That way EVERYONE can see an opera,\nno matter where they live or their station\nin society! Great idea, no?
Yaaaar...? So ya mean the opera ye just\ndid will be spreadin' across the world?
That's the idea—but if we're going to do\nit right, we'll need a proper set.
Speranza carried their entire theater\naround inside the belly of a dragon.
So we'll copy that idea and carry our gear\naround in the belly of my ship!
A stage on a ship?! Yer a blasted genius,\nCap'n! Gar, yer TWO geniuses!
Er, hold on. If ye be usin' our ship,\nthat means we be...
Nooo! Ye can't be breakin' up our\nmotley pirate band, Cap'n!
Oh, for heaven's sake. Stop bawling!\nYou're all coming with me.
I've heard all of you sing out at sea—\nyour shanties are the stuff of legend!
And if you've got courage enough to be a\npirate, you DEFINITELY have the guts to\nclimb on that stage and belt out a tune.
Yar, I've no faith at all in me ability\nto be an opera singer, Cap'n.
Relax, all of you. No one is expecting you\nto be REAL opera singers.
I'm directing this show, and the last thing\nI want is some traditional, boring thing.
Our show will be lively and free!\n...Oh, and maybe a bit bonkers.
Now THAT sounds like a rip-roarin' time!

Hell yeah! We'll do a pirate-style opera,
one those proper, fussy troupes couldn't
put on in a million years. Now come on,
you dogs! Let's do this!
Hoist the anchor! From this day forth,\nwe are Karina's Pirate Opera Troupe!
